title: Changing Aatrox numbers won't fix how clunky he is, he needs quality of life changes
body:
He needs quality of life changes, doesn't matter if he has high numbers he needs more gameplay mechanics and easier to grasp and should feel smooth and crisp to play.

Like E cooldown gets reduced if he hits his Red indicator with his Q, Rewarding the player for hitting his abilities and punishing running away strats like Riven.

I hadn't thought of this before, but it makes a lot more sense now why I found his sweet spots so unnatural. Having a zone of higher power some distance aways from oneself is fine for a champion like Camille, who's all about precision and can dynamically adjust her positioning, and is even okay on Darius, who can just move to his enemy's side, but on Aatrox, that kind of gameplay encourages him to yank himself away from his enemies just to be able to juggle them from afar. It's a complete contradiction of his supposed relentlessness, and merely contributes to a playstyle that feels altogether ill-fitting of the character.
He lacks the tools to position himself well. Q making him stationary makes it extremely difficult compared to Dar and Camille

Exactly, which is why his Q feels so terrible on its own. However, there's also the fact that his E is practically designed to just let him move during Q: the ability's still clunky as shit, but on top of that the whole "counterplay" behind having it lock Aatrox in an animation just flies out the window. Instead of an ability that feels good to use, but also clearly outplayable, we're left with one that feels crap, but also needlessly difficult to outplay properly, as Aatrox has the tools to suddenly reposition a hitbox that is meant to be static.

Also, his kit needs to not conflict with itself, like how do you land auto atack passive hits in between q casts when your enemy has to be somewhat away? How do you not lose in melee range automatically with a Juggernaut? These things need fixinf urgently.

This hits the nail on the head for me, and I think answers [that other bullshit thread](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Qk6MBEKs-good-job-gameplay-boards) pretty well. Up until this point, the complaints players have had haven't been about Aatrox's raw power, but about his feel, as his style of combat right now feels utterly wooden and unresponsive. His E, in particular, very clearly acts purely as a crutch for a defective Q, leading to a playstyle that is altogether janky and reliant on too many inputs to achieve comparatively simpler outputs. Buffing his numbers will certainly increase his win rate, and no doubt increase his play rate, but it won't make his core playstyle any less dysfunctional, which in the long-term is likely to make him suffer from the same issues as Galio, and lose his "fanbase" the moment he drops in viability.

I think there are two QoL changes he really needs: 

-A biger window between Qs. Right now, if you get any CC after your first Q, you most likely won't be able to get off Q2 which means Q3 also won't happen, so you sit with nearly all your damage out of the window and a massivie CD. Aatrox should really have more time to find a good position for the next Q, especially since the range also changes with each Q.

-E should not only work duering a specific window of his Q but dueing the full Q, if you use it a bit to fast or to late it fales and that sucks.

Asides from that, i really think his E shouldn't have any offense tagged on, it just messes with it's usecases. It feels like it should be a pure repositioning tool either for map-mobillity by getting over terrain but mostly for landing Qs if needed. The current AD-boost means you deal less damage with Qs that hit anyway and more with Qs that needthe E for re-aiming, which imo is horrible. I think that combat-power should be moved into the rest of his kit instead, especially the ult.


But even then, a 3 part skill that locks you in place at every use, uses sweetspots on the far end for what's supposed to be a melee that thrives in the midst of battle and even changeing the range with each use just feels clunky.
Haveung a single high impoact move that way would work, but a 3 part combo is just bad. If it was on a mobile champ that could move duering each use(think camille W), it would be something else, but Aatrox locks him self down for a total of ~1.5sec with about no mobillity to compensate...

Imo he needs Urgot and Swain treatment where they make him smoother to play.The e aa reset is good change imo in hotfix but instead of his numbers i think he should have his q animation speed increased and then we see from there (he might need some number nerfs after that kind of changes)

The design they were going for, and what they tried to accomplish for Aatrox, is honestly really smart. It's a great goal.

As Riot said, they wanted him to be a highly skilled melee duelist who works and outsmarts his enemies, utterly decimating them by being a more skilled fighter. Fiora shares a similar fantasy, but Riot has also expressed their failure in her regard two times; her skills are two 'catch all' and there's no real skill involved to hitting weak points.

#Aatrox' kit looks to succesfully accomplish this. 

He's rewarded for dancing into his enemies with his Q, hitting them at just the right moment, and then dancing away from them / toying with them as they attempt to retreat and drawing them in once more. 

This is also why he can't move during the cast animation; he's supposed to predict their movements / force them to go where he wants, and use his small E dash to make that happen. Being able to move at full speed would remove a lot of the 'skill' involved; just get them into the range, press button, transfer burden of skill onto his enemy.

His entire kit is designed to play around his Q and force enemies to be where you want them to be. His W is a slow and re-yank so that you can pull people into it when they think they've escaped, his E is to help reposition it when they think they're safe, and his ulti lets him get people into his ranged sweet-spot due to increased movement speed.

Is he currently too weak? Maybe, maybe not. The dude's been live for a grand total of about 24 hours, so given he looks to have an actual high-skill kit it's hard to say whether or not its tuned correctly. A couple of weeks worth of data and practice should tell us.

Regardless, his kit is much more interesting than it used to be, and his redesign was exclusively a boon.
